channel.title: Factoring expressions
channel.description:
I missed yesterday and we went over factoring expressions. I'm good in math, but I don't pay attention. I payed attention when the teacher was going over the homework, which is what I'm doing right now, but I have come to an equation that I'm not sure how to factor.
2x^2-9x+4 I have gotten as far as: (2x )(x ) But I'm not sure as to whether or not those are negative or positive. Please help!

item.title: Factoring expressions
item.dc:creator: @rscheater13 rscheater13
item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

Thanks chris. I partly figured it out on my own(AKA. I used a site to solve it for me tried to figure out what it was doing), but that is a much better explanation. Thanks again.

Edit: I came to another problem that is similar and was able to do it and finally remembered watching the teacher explain how to do it.

Re-edit: I’m just now finishing that homework. An hour and a half later :mad: That’s what factoring 75 expressions will do for ya.

Read full topic

item.title: Factoring expressions
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

2x^2-8x-x+4 //split the middle up so it adds to 9 and multiplies to 8
2x(x-4)-1(x+4) //factor out
(2x-1)(x-4) //group them

Read full topic
